medium_description_en: Calculates age-adjusted ESR and CRP in adult patients with rheumatoid arthritis.

how_to_use.use_case_en: Do you use the Age-Adjusted ESR and CRP and want to contribute your expertise? Join our contributor team!

next_steps.advice_en: Do you use the Age-Adjusted ESR and CRP and want to contribute your expertise? Join our contributor team!

about.formula_en:
Male:

ESR upper limit of normal, mm/hr = age / 2

CRP upper limit of normal, mg/dL = age / 50

Female:

ESR upper limit of normal, mm/hr = (age + 10) / 2

CRP upper limit of normal, mg/dL = (age / 50) + 0.6

Original/Primary Reference.text: Wener MH, Daum PR, McQuillan GM. The influence of age, sex, and race on the upper reference limit of serum C-reactive protein concentration. J Rheumatol. 2000;27(10):2351-2359.
Miller A, Green M, Robinson D. Simple rule for calculating normal erythrocyte sedimentation rate. Br Med J (Clin Res Ed). 1983;286(6361):266.

Other References.text: Ranganath VK, Elashoff DA, Khanna D, et al. Age adjustment corrects for apparent differences in erythrocyte sedimentation rate and C-reactive protein values at the onset of seropositive rheumatoid arthritis in younger and older patients. J Rheumatol. 2005;32(6):1040-2.

creator_info.about_en: Mark H. Wener, MD, is a professor of laboratory medicine and administration at the University of Washington School of Medicine. He is also the co-director of the university’s scleroderma clinic and director of immunology at the university’s medical centers. Dr. Wener’s primary research is focused on autoimmune rheumatic diseases with complex and unusual manifestations.

seo.meta_description_en: The Age-Adjustment Calculator for ESR and CRP calculates age-adjusted ESR and CRP in patients with late-onset and younger-onset rheumatoid arthritis.
seo.keywords_en: Erythrocyte sedimentation rate, c-reactive protein values, ESR, CRP, age adjustment, age-adjustment, rheumatoid arthritis
